article.title: An Inequality for the Correlation of Two Functions Operating on Symmetric Bivariate Normal Variables

choices: A memoryless non-linearity operates on a noise-free signal.
A linear system operates on a signal corrupted by AWGN.
A memoryless non-linearity operates on a signal corrupted by AWGN.
A linear system operates on a noise-free signal.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula (1) expresses the joint density function of (Z1, Z2) using:
Formula (2) represents the function gi(x) as:
choices: A series expansion using Hermite polynomials

multiple_choice_question.text: The criterion K2 in Section IV is maximized:
choices: Only when g is a linear function.
Only when g is equal to f up to a multiplicative constant.
Only when g is the inverse of f.
